tool.name: Perform open-reference OTU picking
tool.command:
@MPLBACKEND@ pick_open_reference_otus.py --input_fps '$input_fps' -o otus --otu_picking_method '$otu_picking_method' #if str( $ref_sequences.selector ) == 'history' #set $ref = $ref_sequences.reference_fp #else: #set $ref = $ref_sequences.reference_fp.fields.path #end if --reference_fp '$ref' #if str( $prefilter.use_prefilter ) == 'yes' #if str( $prefilter.prefilter_ref_seq.selector ) == 'history' #set $ref = $prefilter.prefilter_ref_seq.prefilter_refseqs_fp #else: #set $ref = $prefilter.prefilter_ref_seq.prefilter_refseqs_fp.fields.path #end if --prefilter_refseqs_fp '$ref' #end if --new_ref_set_id '$new_ref_set_id' $parallel -O "\${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4}" --percent_subsample '$percent_subsample' --prefilter_percent_id '$prefilter_percent_id' #if str($step1_otu_map_fp) != 'None': --step1_otu_map_fp '$step1_otu_map_fp' #end if #if str($step1_failures_fasta_fp) != 'None': --step1_failures_fasta_fp='$step1_failures_fasta_fp' #end if --minimum_failure_threshold '$minimum_failure_threshold' $suppress_step4 --min_otu_size '$min_otu_size' $suppress_taxonomy_assignment $suppress_align_and_tree
#if str( $suppress_align_and_tree ) == "" #if str( $suppress_taxonomy_assignment ) == "" && mv otus/otu_table_mc*_w_tax.biom otus/otu_table_w_tax.biom && mv otus/otu_table_mc*_w_tax_no_pynast_failures.biom otus/otu_table_w_tax_no_pynast_failures.biom #else && mv otus/otu_table_mc*_no_pynast_failures.biom otus/otu_table_no_pynast_failures.biom #end if #end if

param.label: Input sequence files
The OTU picking method to use for reference and de novo steps

param.name: selector
param.label: Reference sequences to query
Reference sequences
Reference databases

param.name: use_prefilter
param.label: Use different reference sequences for the prefilter?

param.name: selector
param.label: Reference sequences to query
Reference sequences
Reference databases
Unique identifier for OTUs that get created in this ref set
param.help: This is useful to support combining of reference sets

param.label: Run in parallel where available?
Percent of failure sequences to include in the subsample to cluster de novo
param.help: Large numbers should give more comprehensive results but will be slower

param.label: Percent of sequence pre-cluster against the reference
param.help: Any reads which fail to hit are discarded (a quality filter)

param.label: Reference OTU picking OTU map to avoid rebuilding if one has already been built (optional)
param.help: This must be an OTU map generated by this workflow, not (for example) by pick_closed_reference_otus

param.label: Reference OTU picking failures fasta filepath, to avoid rebuilding if one has already been built (optional)
param.help: This must be a failures file generated by this workflow, not (for example) by pick_closed_reference_otus

param.label: Minimum number of sequences that must fail to hit the reference for subsampling to be performed
param.help: If fewer than this number of sequences fail to hit the reference, the de novo clustering step will run serially rather than invoking the subsampled open reference approach to improve performance

param.label: Suppress the final de novo OTU picking step?
param.help: It may be necessary for extremely large data sets

param.label: Minimum otu size to retain the OTU
Skip the taxonomy assignment step?
param.help: It results in an OTU table without taxonomy

param.label: Skip the sequence alignment and tree-building steps?

data.name: final_otu_map_mc
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Final OTU map without the OTUs failing the minimum specified OTU size

data.name: otu_table_mc_w_tax
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: OTU table with taxonomic assignment

data.name: otu_table_mc_w_tax_no_pynast_failures
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: OTU table with taxonomic assignment and without sequences failing the alignment to the OTU representative sequences
data.filter: suppress_taxonomy_assignment is False and suppress_align_and_tree is False

data.name: otu_table_mc_no_pynast_failures
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: OTU table without sequences failing the alignment to the OTU representative sequences
data.filter: suppress_taxonomy_assignment is True and suppress_align_and_tree is False

data.name: new_refseqs
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: New reference sequences (OTU + input reference sequences)

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool performs open-reference OTU picking from sequences.
This script is broken down into 4 possible OTU picking steps, and 2 steps involving the creation of OTU tables and trees.
More information about this tool is available on `QIIME documentation <http://qiime.org/scripts/pick_open_reference_otus.html>`_.
